sen.j: 宮津市（みやづし）は、京都府の市。
sen.e: Miyazu City is a city in Kyoto Prefecture.
Miyazu City is a city in Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 日本三景の天橋立がある、日本海に面した海園都市である。
sen.e: The city has Amanohashidate, one of "The three most scenic spots of Japan," and is called the Kaien-toshi, or oceanfront city, bordering the Sea of Japan.
The city has Amanohashidate, one of "The three most scenic spots of Japan," and is called the Kaien-toshi, or oceanfront city, bordering the Sea of Japan.

sen.j: 1600年（慶長5年）関ヶ原の戦いの功により京極高知に徳川家康から丹後一国が与えられ丹後藩が成立する。
sen.e: 1600: As a reward for his distinguished service in the Battle of Sekigahara, Takatomo KYOGOKU was awarded the entire Tango Province by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, and accordingly, the Tango domain was established.

1600: As a reward for his distinguished service in the Battle of Sekigahara, Takatomo KYOGOKU was awarded the entire Tango Province by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, and accordingly, the Tango domain was established.

1600: As a reward for his distinguished service in the Battle of Sekigahara, Takatomo KYOGOKU was awarded the entire Tango Province by Ieyasu TOKUGAWA, and accordingly, the Tango domain was established.

sen.j: のちに京極高知の三子により丹後藩は三分割され、宮津藩、舞鶴藩、峰山藩の丹後三藩が成立した。
sen.e: Subsequently, the Tango domain was divided into three regions by the three sons of Takatomo KYOGOKU, and the three domains of Tango, the Miyazu, Maizuru, and Mineyama domains, were established.
Subsequently, the Tango domain was divided into three regions by the three sons of Takatomo KYOGOKU, and the three domains of Tango, Miyazu, Maizuru, and Mineyama, were established.
Subsequently, the Tango domain was divided into three regions by the three sons of Takatomo KYOGOKU, and the three domains of Tango, Miyazu, Maizuru, and Mineyama, were established.

sen.j: 宮津藩京極家は改易され、替わって本庄家が藩主となった。
sen.e: The Kyogoku family forfeited the properties and the warrior class, and instead, the Honjo family became the domain lord.
The Kyogoku family forfeited all property as well as their status as warrior class, and instead, the Honjo family became the domain lord.
The Kyogoku family forfeited all property as well as their status as warrior class, and instead, the Honjo family became the domain lord.

sen.j: 1954年（昭和29年）6月1日：与謝郡宮津町・栗田村・吉津村・府中村・日置村・世屋村・養老村・日ヶ谷村が合併し、市制施行。
sen.e: June 1, 1954: Miyazu-cho in Yosa-gun, Kunda-mura, Yoshizu-mura, Fuchu-mura, Hioki-mura, Seya-mura, Yoro-mura, and Higatani-mura were merged to implement the shisei (grant of city status).
June 1, 1954: Miyazu-cho in Yosa-gun, Kunda-mura, Yoshizu-mura, Fuchu-mura, Hioki-mura, Seya-mura, Yoro-mura, and Higatani-mura were merged to implement the shisei (grant of city status).
June 1, 1954: Miyazu-cho, Kunda-mura, Yoshizu-mura, Fuchu-mura, Hioki-mura, Seya-mura, Yoro-mura, and Higatani-mura in Yosa-gun were merged to implement the shisei (grant of city status).
sen.cmt: これらの町村は全て与謝郡だったようなので、与謝郡の場所を変更しました。

sen.j: 1956年（昭和31年）9月20日：加佐郡由良村を編入。
sen.e: September 20, 1956: Miyazu City absorbed Yura-mura, Kasa-gun.

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 市の代表駅は、宮津駅（北近畿タンゴ鉄道北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮津線・北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮福線）であるが、観光の拠点としての中心となるのは、むしろ天橋立駅（北近畿タンゴ鉄道宮津線）である。
sen.e: The Miyazu Station (the Kitakinki Tango Railway Miyazu Line and the Kitakinki Tango Railway Miyafuku Line) is the main train station in the city, but, for tourism, the Amanohashidate Station (the Kitakinki Tango Railway Miyazu Line) is the center.

The Miyazu Station (the Kitakinki Tango Railway Miyazu Line and the Kitakinki Tango Railway Miyafuku Line) is the main train station in the city, but, for tourism, the Amanohashidate Station (the Kitakinki Tango Railway Miyazu Line) is the center.

The Miyazu Station (the Kitakinki Tango Railway Miyazu Line and the Kitakinki Tango Railway Miyafuku Line) is the main train station in the city, but, for tourism, the Amanohashidate Station (the Kitakinki Tango Railway Miyazu Line) is the center.

sen.j: 宮福線にはこのほかに、宮村駅、喜多駅、辛皮駅があり、宮津線には、岩滝口駅、栗田駅、丹後由良駅がある。
sen.e: Other than those two stations, Miyazu City has the Miyamura Station, the Kita Station and the Karakawa Station on the Miyafuku Line, and has the Iwataki-guchi Station, the Kunda Station and the Tango Yura Station on the Miyazu Line.

Other than the two stations mentioned previously, Miyazu City has the Miyamura Station, the Kita Station and the Karakawa Station on the Miyafuku Line, together with the Iwataki-guchi Station, the Kunda Station and the Tango Yura Station on the Miyazu Line.

Other than the two stations mentioned previously, Miyazu City has the Miyamura Station, the Kita Station and the Karakawa Station on the Miyafuku Line, together with the Iwataki-guchi Station, the Kunda Station and the Tango Yura Station on the Miyazu Line.

sen.j: 精霊船という大きな灯篭を宮津港で燃やし付近に小さな追っかけ灯篭を流す。
sen.e: Big toro (hanging lantern) as 'Ship of souls' are fired at Miyazu Port, and then, small chasing toro are sent toward the big toro.

sen.j: 多数の追っかけ灯篭が流れるのは非常に美しい。
sen.e: The sight of many chasing toro's floating down is magnificent.
The scene of so many toro's chasing the big toro is truly beautiful to behold.
The scene of so many toro's chasing the big toro is truly beautiful to behold.
